title: Documentation for IntelPackage breaks lmod module generation

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
The readthedocs [IntelPackage](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_systems/intelpackage.html?highlight=intel%20compiler#installing-intel-tools-within-spack) page directs the user to construct an environment in which the intel compiler package is seen to have been installed by itself. I have done this this long-way round in the past, by installing the Intel compiler with `%gcc`, then installing the same compiler again with the "gcc-compiled" `%intel`; but this breaks the generated lmod hierarchy (when, as by default, the compiler is a factor in the hierarchy) because the intel module that is expected to provide access to intel-compiled packages is, itself, contained in that module hierarchy.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install intel@version %intel@version
$ spack module lmod refresh -y
```
